tools.description:
Creates a new document that app can write to. And user can select where they'd like to create it.

Instead of selecting from existing PDF documents, 
the ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT lets users select where they'd like to create a new document, such as within another app that manages the document's storage. 
And then return the URI location of document that you can read from and write to.

mime_type.description: The MIME type of the document to be created (e.g., 'text/plain', 'application/pdf').

initial_name.description: The suggested name for the new document.

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the newly created document. URI name can be inferred from user query

examples:
# Create a new text document
new_doc_uri = ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT(mime_type='text/plain', initial_name='New Document.txt')

# Create a new PDF file
new_pdf_uri = ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT(mime_type='application/pdf', initial_name='Report.pdf')

# Create a new image file
new_image_uri = ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT(mime_type='image/jpeg', initial_name='Photo.jpg')

Creates a new document that app can write to. And user can select where they'd like to create it.

Instead of selecting from existing PDF documents, 
the ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT lets users select where they'd like to create a new document, such as within another app that manages the document's storage. 
And then return the URI location of document that you can read from and write to.

mime_type.description: The MIME type of the document to be created (e.g., 'text/plain', 'application/pdf').

initial_name.description: The suggested name for the new document.

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the newly created document. URI name can be inferred from user query

examples:
# Create a new text document
new_doc_uri = ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT(mime_type='text/plain', initial_name='New Document.txt')

# Create a new PDF file
new_pdf_uri = ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT(mime_type='application/pdf', initial_name='Report.pdf')

# Create a new image file
new_image_uri = ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT(mime_type='image/jpeg', initial_name='Photo.jpg')

query: Please update the contact for John using URI content://contacts/people/john; his phone number should now be 123-456-7890.
Could you edit the details for my coworker at content://contacts/people/alice to update her email to alice@example.com and set her company to AcmeCorp?
I need to change the address for the contact at content://contacts/people/robert. Please update his address to '123 Elm Street'.
Modify the contact data for the person at URI content://contacts/people/sam by changing the name to 'Samuel Lee'.
Update my friend Anna's contact that is on content://contacts/people/anna: set her email to anna@domain.org and phone to 555-1234.
I want to open the edit interface for the contact at content://contacts/people/michael without any immediate changes.
Please update my mentor's details; use the contact URI content://contacts/people/jane and change her company to TechSoft.
Edit the contact located at content://contacts/people/roboto: modify the address to '456 Silicon Blvd' and update the phone number to 987-654-3210.
Can you adjust the contact details for the URI content://contacts/people/carter by changing the email to carter@company.com?
Kindly update my business partner's contact information at content://contacts/people/kelly so that the name field is now 'Kelly Brown'.
I require a change for the contact at content://contacts/people/leo: please update his phone to 2223334444 and his email to leo@enterprise.com.
Please modify the record for my friend Sara at content://contacts/people/sara by updating her address to '789 Maple Ave' and assigning her company as Innovate Ltd.
I need to update the contact details for Brian found at content://contacts/people/brian; change his name to 'Brian O'Connor' and his email to brian.oconnor@example.net.
Could you please update the information for the contact at URI content://contacts/people/zoe so that her phone number is now 8005550001?
I want to edit the contact details using the URI content://contacts/people/arthur. Please set his company to 'OldSchool Inc.'
Please update Mark's contact on content://contacts/people/mark by setting his phone number to 123-456-7890.

tools.description:
Edit an existing contact.

This function allows the user to edit the details of a specific contact
based on the provided contact URI. Additional contact information can be
provided to pre-fill certain fields in the edit form.
Note: 
    The contact_uri can be obtained in two primary ways: 
    1. Using the contact URI returned by the ACTION_PICK function.
    2. Accessing the list of all contacts directly (requires appropriate permissions).

contact_uri.description: A content URI as a string, pointing to the contact to be edited. This URI can be obtained from the ACTION_PICK function or by querying the contacts database.

contact_info.description: A dictionary containing additional contact information to pre-fill in the edit form. Keys should correspond to contact fields (available key:  'email', 'phone', 'name', 'company', 'address'), and values should be the data to pre-fill. Default is None.

examples:
# Update Minji's phone number to 010-9876-5432 using contact_uri content://contacts/people/minji
contact_uri=ACTION_EDIT_CONTACT(contact_uri='content://contacts/people/minji', contact_info={'phone': '010-9876-5432'})

# Update Daniels company to samsung and email to daniel@samsung.com using contact_uri content://contacts/people/daniel
contact_uri=ACTION_EDIT_CONTACT(contact_uri='content://contacts/people/daniel', contact_info={'company': 'samsung', 'email': 'daniel@samsung.com'})

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the edited contact, or null if the edit was cancelled.

contact_uri=ACTION_EDIT_CONTACT(contact_uri='content://contacts/people/minji', contact_info={'phone': '010-9876-5432'})

# Update Daniels company to samsung and email to daniel@samsung.com using contact_uri content://contacts/people/daniel
contact_uri=ACTION_EDIT_CONTACT(contact_uri='content://contacts/people/daniel', contact_info={'company': 'samsung', 'email': 'daniel@samsung.com'})

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the edited contact, or null if the edit was cancelled.

query: Kindly modify Rachel's contact at content://contacts/people/rachel by setting her address to '789 Cherry Lane'.

tools.description:
Edit an existing contact.

This function allows the user to edit the details of a specific contact
based on the provided contact URI. Additional contact information can be
provided to pre-fill certain fields in the edit form.
Note: 
    The contact_uri can be obtained in two primary ways: 
    1. Using the contact URI returned by the ACTION_PICK function.
    2. Accessing the list of all contacts directly (requires appropriate permissions).

contact_uri.description: A content URI as a string, pointing to the contact to be edited. This URI can be obtained from the ACTION_PICK function or by querying the contacts database.

contact_info.description: A dictionary containing additional contact information to pre-fill in the edit form. Keys should correspond to contact fields (available key:  'email', 'phone', 'name', 'company', 'address'), and values should be the data to pre-fill. Default is None.

examples:

contact_uri=ACTION_EDIT_CONTACT(contact_uri='content://contacts/people/minji', contact_info={'phone': '010-9876-5432'})

# Update Daniels company to samsung and email to daniel@samsung.com using contact_uri content://contacts/people/daniel
contact_uri=ACTION_EDIT_CONTACT(contact_uri='content://contacts/people/daniel', contact_info={'company': 'samsung', 'email': 'daniel@samsung.com'})

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the edited contact, or null if the edit was cancelled.

tools.description:
Edit an existing contact.

This function allows the user to edit the details of a specific contact
based on the provided contact URI. Additional contact information can be
provided to pre-fill certain fields in the edit form.
Note: 
    The contact_uri can be obtained in two primary ways: 
    1. Using the contact URI returned by the ACTION_PICK function.
    2. Accessing the list of all contacts directly (requires appropriate permissions).

contact_uri.description: A content URI as a string, pointing to the contact to be edited. This URI can be obtained from the ACTION_PICK function or by querying the contacts database.

contact_info.description: A dictionary containing additional contact information to pre-fill in the edit form. Keys should correspond to contact fields (available key:  'email', 'phone', 'name', 'company', 'address'), and values should be the data to pre-fill. Default is None.

examples:
# Update Minji's phone number to 010-9876-5432 using contact_uri content://contacts/people/minji
contact_uri=ACTION_EDIT_CONTACT(contact_uri='content://contacts/people/minji', contact_info={'phone': '010-9876-5432'})

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the edited contact, or null if the edit was cancelled.

query: Please open a document in PDF format from my device.
Can you show me how to select text files? I need to choose multiple files at once.
I'd like to access a couple of documents. They can be either PDFs or plain texts, and I want to select them at the same time.
I want to pick just one image file for editing, preferably any kind of image.
Help me open a Microsoft Word document from my storage.
Open a document for me; I need any single file in text format.
I want to select multiple image documents. Please allow me the option to choose several images at once.
Allow me to pick a spreadsheet file; I'm looking specifically for Excel files.
Retrieve multiple PDF files from my cloud storage, please.
I need to open a single document containing audio content from my device.
Please provide me with an option to select a single video file from my device.
Select documents for me: I want both text and PDF files, and I prefer to select several at once.
I have a requirement to open a file in XML format. Can you help me choose one?
Access document: I need to open a single file with application JSON format.
I require to open multiple documents. Could you allow me to pick files from both images and spreadsheets at once?
Choose one PNG image file from my device.

tools.description: Allows the user to select one or multiple documents of specified MIME types from local storage, cloud services, or external document providers. This action provides long-term persistent access to the selected documents, making it ideal for use-cases such as file management applications, editors, or cloud-synced apps where continuous access to the files is necessary.

mime_types.description: A list of MIME type(s) for the document(s) to select. Accepts multiple MIME types (e.g., ["application/pdf", "text/plain"]).

allow_multiple.description: Allows selection of multiple documents if set to True. Defaults to False.

returns.description: A list of persistent content URIs as strings, each pointing to the selected document. Returns an empty list if no document is selected or the operation is canceled.

examples:
# Select a single image document for long-term editing
image_uris = ACTION_OPEN_DOCUMENT(["image/*"])

# Select multiple types of documents for persistent management
doc_uris = ACTION_OPEN_DOCUMENT(["application/pdf", "text/plain"], allow_multiple=True)

tools.description: Allows the user to quickly select one or multiple existing files of a specified MIME type from local storage. This action is intended for temporary and immediate use-cases, such as attaching files to messages, emails, or quickly accessing images and videos. It returns temporary access (non-persistent) URIs to the selected files, suitable for short-term or one-time usage.

mime_type.description: The MIME type of the file(s) to select (e.g., "image/*", "audio/*", "video/*", "*/*").

allow_multiple.description: Allows the user to select multiple files if set to True. Defaults to False.

returns.description: A list of temporary content URIs as strings, each pointing to the selected file. Returns an empty list if no file is selected or the operation is canceled.

examples:
# Quickly select a single image for immediate use
image_uris = ACTION_GET_CONTENT("image/*")

# Quickly select multiple PDFs for immediate sharing
doc_uris = ACTION_GET_CONTENT("application/pdf", allow_multiple=True)

tools.description: Allows the user to quickly select one or multiple existing files of a specified MIME type from local storage. This action is intended for temporary and immediate use-cases, such as attaching files to messages, emails, or quickly accessing images and videos. It returns temporary access (non-persistent) URIs to the selected files, suitable for short-term or one-time usage.

mime_type.description: The MIME type of the file(s) to select (e.g., "image/*", "audio/*", "video/*", "*/*").

allow_multiple.description: Allows the user to select multiple files if set to True. Defaults to False.

returns.description: A list of temporary content URIs as strings, each pointing to the selected file. Returns an empty list if no file is selected or the operation is canceled.

examples:
# Quickly select a single image for immediate use
image_uris = ACTION_GET_CONTENT("image/*")

# Quickly select multiple PDFs for immediate sharing
doc_uris = ACTION_GET_CONTENT("application/pdf", allow_multiple=True)

query: Please open the PDF file located at content://documents/report.pdf.
Show me the picture from content://gallery/pic01.jpg; it's a JPEG image.
Can you display the video at content://videos/movie.mp4? It's an MP4 file.
I need to view the audio clip from content://music/song.mp3 for review.
Access the document at content://documents/resume.docx so I can review my resume.
Open the presentation file at content://presentations/sales.pptx.
I want to see the image from content://photos/vacation.png; please open it as it's clearly a PNG file.
Show the infographic by navigating to content://infographics/overview.svg; it's a vector graphic in SVG format.
I'd like to open the plain text manual found at content://docs/manual.txt. Can you display it?
Could you display this file from the link: content://shared/file.zip?
Let me view the high quality portrait image at URI content://gallery/highres.jpg; note it's a JPEG file.
I require opening the video file available at content://videos/sec_record.mov; it's in QuickTime format.
Display the ebook by opening content://ebooks/novel.epub.
Please open content://slides/demo.key; it's my Keynote presentation.
Show the content at URI content://music/live_record.wav; it's an audio file in WAV format.
Please open the compressed package file stored at content://shared/archive.zip.

tools.description: Opens or displays the content specified by a given URI directly. This action enables immediate viewing or opening of documents, images, videos, audio files, and other supported content types without showing any picker UI. Intended for scenarios where the content URI is already known or obtained from a prior selection.

uri.description: The content URI pointing to the content to open.

mime_type.description: The MIME type of the content (optional, used for context or verification).

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the content that was opened, or null if opening failed.

examples:
# Open a document URI
ACTION_OPEN_CONTENT(document_uri)

# Open an image URI
ACTION_OPEN_CONTENT(image_uri)

query: I want to choose a ringtone for my alarm; can you let me pick one from my device?
Please open the ringtone picker so I can select the perfect tone for my morning wake-up.
Can you enable the ringtone selection tool? I need to set a new alarm sound.
I have to update my phone's alarm sound. Let me choose a ringtone from the available options.
Help me pick a ringtone for my alarm feature. I want a new sound for my notifications.
Could you let me select a ringtone from my device to use as my alarm tone?
I would like to change my alarm ringtone. Please trigger the ringtone picker for me.
Please allow me to choose a ringtone from my phone so I can update my alarm sound.
Open the ringtone selection tool so I can find a new tone for my alarm clock.
I need a refresher for my alarm sound. Let me choose a ringtone to set a new tone on my device.
Activate the ringtone picker function. I want to select a custom tone for my alarm.
I'm looking to personalize my alarm; please let me pick a ringtone from my options.
How do I set a new alarm tone? I want to choose a ringtone from my phone's collection.
I want to update my alarm settings with a new ring sound. Could you open the ringtone selection tool?
Start the ringtone picker so I can choose a unique sound for my morning alarm.
I need a fresh ringtone for my morning alarm. Please open the ringtone chooser.

tools.description:
Let user select a ringtone and return the URI of the selected ringtone.

This function allows the user to select a ringtone from the device's ringtone picker.
It returns the content URI of the selected ringtone that can be use to set alarm.

returns.description: A content URI as a string for the chosen ringtone. keep in mind that ringtone was already chosen by the user.

examples:
# Let the user pick a ringtone
ringtone_uri = ACTION_GET_RINGTONE()

This function allows the user to select a ringtone from the device's ringtone picker.
It returns the content URI of the selected ringtone that can be use to set alarm.

returns.description: A content URI as a string for the chosen ringtone. keep in mind that ringtone was already chosen by the user.

examples:
# Let the user pick a ringtone
ringtone_uri = ACTION_GET_RINGTONE()

query: Take a picture with the default camera option.
I would like you to capture an image using the camera, and let the device decide where to save it.
Please snap a photo and save it to content://myfolder/photo1.jpg.
Open the camera to take a selfie, no file destination specified.
Please capture a picture and store it at content://myapp/images/portrait.jpg.
I need to click an image right now; let the system choose the saving location.
Snap an image for me. I have no preference for the filename.
Launch the camera and capture an image, saving it to content://storage/emulated/0/DCIM/Camera/newpic.jpg, please.
Capture a photo and store it at custom location: content://custom/path/picture.jpg for later access.
Take a shot with my camera; there's no need to specify a save location.
I want to use the phone's camera to record a picture immediately without a specified file location.
Execute the camera capture action and, if possible, save at content://another/app/temp.jpg.
Could you please take a photograph? I'm not particular about where it's stored.
Take a snapshot using my camera app and use the following path: content://user/specified/location for storage.
Quick capture with the camera; let the system automatically determine the storage location.
Can you click an image with my camera? I want it saved at content://photos/holiday/img1.jpg.

tools.description:
Capture a picture using the camera app and return the URI of the saved photo.

This function uses the ACTION_IMAGE_CAPTURE intent to open the camera app and capture a photo.
The photo is saved to a URI location, which is returned by this function.
User can optionally specify a filename or save location via the content URI parameters.

file_uri.description: A content URI indicating where to save the captured image (optional). If not provided, the camera app will choose a location.

returns.description: A content URI as a string pointing to the captured image. Returns None if the capture is canceled or fails.

examples:
# Capture an image and let the system decide the save location
photo_uri = ACTION_IMAGE_CAPTURE()

# Capture an image and specify the save location
photo_uri = ACTION_IMAGE_CAPTURE()

tools.description:
Capture a picture using the camera app and return the URI of the saved photo.

This function uses the ACTION_IMAGE_CAPTURE intent to open the camera app and capture a photo.
The photo is saved to a URI location, which is returned by this function.
User can optionally specify a filename or save location via the content URI parameters.

file_uri.description: A content URI indicating where to save the captured image (optional). If not provided, the camera app will choose a location.

returns.description: A content URI as a string pointing to the captured image. Returns None if the capture is canceled or fails.

examples:
# Capture an image and let the system decide the save location
photo_uri = ACTION_IMAGE_CAPTURE()

# Capture an image and specify the save location
photo_uri = ACTION_IMAGE_CAPTURE()

Add a new contact for my colleague Mark, reachable at phone number 321-654-0987.
Please add a new contact for Robert with the email address robert@gmail.com.

tools.description:
Insert a new contact.

This function allows the user to create a new contact with the provided
contact information. It will open the contact creation interface with
pre-filled information based on the provided data.

contact_info.description: A dictionary containing the contact details to insert. Possible keys include 'name', 'phone', 'email', 'address', etc.

returns.description: A content URI as a string pointing to the newly created contact. Returns None if the operation is canceled or fails.

examples:
# Insert a new contact with name and phone number
new_contact_uri = ACTION_INSERT_CONTACT({"name":  "John Doe", "phone":  "123-456-7890"})

query: Please pick a contact from my address book.
Select a contact for further actions from my list.
Retrieve a contact's phone number from my contacts.
Could you fetch a phone contact? I mean, get the phone number URI from my contacts.
Please provide the email address of a selected contact.
Obtain an email URI for one of my contacts.
I need to access the mailing address of a contact.
Pick a contact's postal address from my phone contacts.
Fetch a contact detail for me; just choose one entry from my contacts.
I am looking to select a contactno particular data type, just the contact itself.
Get me a contact record, please.
Show me a phone number entry from my contacts directory.
I want to pick an email from my contacts; select one email linked with a contact.
Help me choose a contactpreferably one including their address information.
Can you provide a selected contact? I don't need any specific details, just the contact itself.
I need to choose a contact from my list.

tools.description:
This function allows the user to select a contact or specific contact information (such as phone
number, email, or postal address) and returns a content URI for the selected data.

data_type.description: The type of contact data to pick. Default is 'contact' to pick a contact URI. Other options: 'phone', 'email', 'address' to pick a specific piece of info.

returns.description: A content URI as a string pointing to the selected contact or data (phone, email, etc.), or None if canceled.

examples:
# Pick a contact URI
contact_uri = ACTION_PICK()

# Pick an email address from contacts
email_uri = ACTION_PICK("email")

query: Set an alarm for 6:45 AM with the label 'Wake up early'.
Please create an alarm at 22:30 without any custom message.
Could you schedule a repeating alarm on Tuesday and Friday at 7:00 AM, calling it 'Exercise'?
Set an alarm for 13:15 with the message 'Meeting Reminder' and disable vibration.
I need an alarm for 05:00 but please skip showing the clock user interface.
Display an alarm set for 9:05 AM with the ringtone 'ringtone://morning' and the note 'Get Ready'.
Could you kindly set an alarm for 23:59 without any extra embellishments?
Set an alarm for midnight (0:00) with the label 'New Year's countdown'.
Please set a 15:30 alarm that repeats on Saturday with the note 'Afternoon nap'.
I require an alarm at 11:11 every Monday for a weekly check-inlabel it appropriately.
Set an alarm for 18:20 with the message 'Dinner time' and ensure the clock UI doesn't pop up.
Please create an 8:50 AM alarm labeled 'Meeting', and make sure it skips the UI confirmation and doesn't vibrate.
Could you add an alarm set to 16:40 without specifying a custom label or vibration settings?
Arrange an alarm for 19:25 that repeats on Wednesday, Thursday, and Sunday, and tag it 'Study Time'.
Set my alarm to 12:00 with the label 'Noon Reminder' and use the ringtone at 'http://example.com/ringtone.mp3'.
Set an alarm for 5:30 AM with the label 'Gym'.

tools.description: Set an alarm with the given parameters.

EXTRA_DAYS.description: List of days when the alarm should repeat (e.g., ["Monday", "Wednesday"]). Empty list or missing means no repeat.

EXTRA_VIBRATE.description: Whether the alarm should vibrate. Default is True.

EXTRA_RINGTONE.description: The URI of the ringtone to use for this alarm. Default ringtone if None.

EXTRA_SKIP_UI.description: If true, sets the alarm without showing the clock app UI for confirmation.

returns.description: A string describing the alarm set, including alarm_id, time and message.
example: Alarm set for alarm_id: alarm_no1 - 7:30 AM: Morning alarm

examples:
# Set an alarm for 7:30 AM
ACTION_SET_ALARM({"EXTRA_HOUR": 7, "EXTRA_MINUTES": 30, "EXTRA_MESSAGE": "Morning alarm"})

EXTRA_DAYS.description: List of days when the alarm should repeat (e.g., ["Monday", "Wednesday"]). Empty list or missing means no repeat.

EXTRA_VIBRATE.description: Whether the alarm should vibrate. Default is True.

EXTRA_RINGTONE.description: The URI of the ringtone to use for this alarm. Default ringtone if None.

EXTRA_SKIP_UI.description: If true, sets the alarm without showing the clock app UI for confirmation.

returns.description: A string describing the alarm set, including alarm_id, time and message.
example: Alarm set for alarm_id: alarm_no1 - 7:30 AM: Morning alarm

examples:
# Set an alarm for 7:30 AM
ACTION_SET_ALARM({"EXTRA_HOUR": 7, "EXTRA_MINUTES": 30, "EXTRA_MESSAGE": "Morning alarm"})

query: Set a timer for 10 minutes, please.
Could you start a countdown of 1 hours 30 minutes with the timer labeled 'Exercise'?
Begin a timer that lasts for 15 seconds and name it 'Quick test'.
I need a 2 hours timer with a message 'Reading Marathon'.
Set a kitchen timer for 25 minutes, and make sure to skip the UI.
Timer: 3 hours 45 minutes with the label 'Movie Marathon'.
Hey, set a timer for 50 minutes for laundry.
Start a countdown for 5 minutes 30 seconds.
Could you initiate a timer for 80 minutes and tag it as 'Study Session'?
I want to set a timer for 1 hours.
Please run a countdown for 7 minutes with no extra message.
Please start a timer for 1 hours 15 minutes 5 seconds labeled as 'Workout Timer'.
I need a silent timer for 30 minutes.
Could you set a timer for 10 minutes and include the text 'Tea Time'?
Start a countdown timer for 90 seconds to time my experiment.
Please set a timer for 15 minutes.

tools.description: Set a countdown timer with the given parameters.

duration.description:
The duration of the timer in the format "HH hours MM minutes SS seconds".
For example, "1 hours 30 minutes" or "10 minutes" or "1 hours 30 minutes 15 seconds",

EXTRA_MESSAGE.description: A custom message to identify the timer. Default is an empty string.

EXTRA_SKIP_UI.description:
A boolean specifying whether the responding app must skip its UI when setting the timer.
If true, the app must bypass any confirmation UI and start the specified timer. Default is True.

returns.description: A string describing the timer set, including duration and custom message if provided.
example: Timer set for 10 minutes: Pasta timer

examples:
# Set a Pasta timer for 10 minutes
ACTION_SET_TIMER({"duration": 10 minutes, "EXTRA_MESSAGE": "Pasta timer"})

query: Set an alarm for 2 hours 30 minutes and label it 'Nap Time'.

tools.description: Set a countdown timer with the given parameters.

duration.description:
The duration of the timer in the format "HH hours MM minutes SS seconds".
For example, "1 hours 30 minutes" or "10 minutes" or "1 hours 30 minutes 15 seconds",

EXTRA_MESSAGE.description: A custom message to identify the timer. Default is an empty string.

EXTRA_SKIP_UI.description:
A boolean specifying whether the responding app must skip its UI when setting the timer.
If true, the app must bypass any confirmation UI and start the specified timer. Default is True.

returns.description: A string describing the timer set, including duration and custom message if provided.
example: Timer set for 10 minutes: Pasta timer

examples:
# Set a Pasta timer for 10 minutes
ACTION_SET_TIMER({"duration": 10 minutes, "EXTRA_MESSAGE": "Pasta timer"})

EXTRA_MESSAGE.description: A custom message to identify the timer. Default is an empty string.

EXTRA_SKIP_UI.description:
A boolean specifying whether the responding app must skip its UI when setting the timer.
If true, the app must bypass any confirmation UI and start the specified timer. Default is True.

returns.description: A string describing the timer set, including duration and custom message if provided.
example: Timer set for 10 minutes: Pasta timer

examples:
# Set a Pasta timer for 10 minutes
ACTION_SET_TIMER({"duration": 10 minutes, "EXTRA_MESSAGE": "Pasta timer"})

query: Record a video using my camera.
Please record a video and save it at content://videos/myclip.mp4.
Can you capture a quick video clip for me?
I want to shoot a video using the camera and let the system decide the save location.
Initiate video recording now, no need to specify a file path.
Kindly capture a video and set the storage location to content://example/uri.
Could you use my camera to record a short video, saving it at content://videos/event.mp4?
Record a video using the default camera settings.
I'd like to record a video clip; please open the camera app to start.
Execute video recording with the file destination set to content://media/videos/clip.mp4, please.
Begin a new video capture session with my camera right away.
Start capturing a video for me, and let the system choose where to store it.
I need a video recorded; could you direct the camera to save it at content://recordings/video1.mp4?
Record a video right now without specifying any particular file URI.
Please use the camera to record a brief video clip and save it at content://myvideos/take.mp4.
Please record a video using your camera app.

tools.description:
Capture a video using the camera app and return the URI of the recorded video.

This function uses the ACTION_VIDEO_CAPTURE intent to open the camera app and record a video.
The video is saved to a URI location, which is returned by this function.

file_uri.description: A content URI indicating where to save the recorded video (optional). If not provided, the camera app will choose a location.

returns.description: A content URI as a string pointing to the recorded video.

examples:
# Capture a video and let the system decide the save location
video_uri = ACTION_VIDEO_CAPTURE()

# Capture a video and specify the save location
video_uri = ACTION_VIDEO_CAPTURE()

Open up the contact's information using the URI content://contacts/contacts/1516.

Show me the complete contact info with URI content://contacts/people/1920.

tools.description:
View a contact's details.

This function opens the contact specified by the given content URI and displays its details (name, phone, email, etc.).

contact_uri.description: The content URI of the contact to view.

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the contact viewed or its details (name, phone, email, etc.), or null if the viewing was unsuccessful.

examples:
# View a contact's details
ACTION_VIEW_CONTACT(contact_uri)

tools.description:
View a contact's details.

This function opens the contact specified by the given content URI and displays its details (name, phone, email, etc.).

contact_uri.description: The content URI of the contact to view.

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the contact viewed or its details (name, phone, email, etc.), or null if the viewing was unsuccessful.

query: Open the camera so I can snap a picture.
Could you launch my still image camera app, please?
Please start the photo mode on my device.
I would like to take a photo; open the still image camera for me.
Activate the camera app in photo mode.
Launch the device's still photo camera so I can capture an image.
Start the photo taking application on my phone.
Please open the still image camera  I need to snap a quick picture.
Could you initiate the camera for taking a still picture?
Fire up the photo camera app so I can take a shot.
I want to capture a momentplease open my device's still photo camera.
Open the smartphone's still image camera to take a picture.
Kick start the camera app so I can snap a high-quality image.
Can you open my camera in photo mode? I need to click a picture.
Could you please start the still image camera app so I can take a photo?

tools.description:
Launches the device's still image camera application.

This intent action is used to open the system camera in still-image mode, allowing the user to take a photo.

returns.description: A confirmation message indicating the still image camera app was successfully opened.

examples:
# Open the camera app to take a photo
INTENT_ACTION_STILL_IMAGE_CAMERA()

returns.description: A confirmation message indicating that the call is being initiated to the specified phone number.

query: What's the phone number of the contact at contact://john_doe?
Retrieve the email for my colleague at contact://jane_smith.
I need to find the physical address of my friend at contact://alice_representative.
Show me a summary of the contact at contact://bob_resource.
What is the email associated with URI contact://eve_officer?
Can you extract the phone details from contact://charlie?
I need to fetch the address from the contact record found at contact://david_address.
Get the contact summary from this URI: contact://emma_summary.
Fetch the email for contact: contact://frank_email and send it to me.
Please get phone information for the URI contact://george_mobile.
Retrieve the complete record from contact://hannah.
I want the mailing address for the contact located at contact://ian_mapping.
Find out the email address of the person at contact://julia_mail.
Identify the phone number for contact://kevin_communication.
Could you pull up detailed information for contact://lisa_info?
Can you get the phone details from contact://sam_mobile?

tools.description:
Retrieve specific information from a contact by URI.

For example, given a contact URI, this function can fetch details like phone number, email, or address.

contact_uri.description: The content URI of the contact to retrieve information from.

info_type.description: The type of information to retrieve (e.g., 'phone', 'email', 'address'). If not specified, returns a summary of the contact.

returns.description: The requested contact information (e.g., a phone number, email, or address) as a string, or None if not available.

examples:
# Get a phone number from a contact
phone = get_contact_info(contact_uri, "phone")

contact_uri.description: The content URI of the contact to retrieve information from.

info_type.description: The type of information to retrieve (e.g., 'phone', 'email', 'address'). If not specified, returns a summary of the contact.

returns.description: The requested contact information (e.g., a phone number, email, or address) as a string, or None if not available.

examples:
# Get a phone number from a contact
phone = get_contact_info(contact_uri, "phone")

tools.description:
Given a content URI pointing to a specific piece of contact data (e.g., a phone number or email), retrieve that information.

For instance, if provided a content URI for a phone number, this function returns the phone number string.

data_uri.description: The content URI of the specific contact data to retrieve.

returns.description: The contact data (phone number, email, etc.) as a string, or None if not available.

examples:
# Suppose we got a phone number URI from ACTION_PICK, now retrieve the number string
phone_number = get_contact_info_from_uri(phone_number_uri)

query: Could you open the general settings on my device?
I want to see my Wi-Fi settings now.
Display settings please.
Switch to airplane mode settings for my phone.
Can you bring up my Bluetooth settings?
Take me to the wireless & network settings screen.
I need to change my APN settings.
Open the location settings on my phone.
I'd like to modify my date and time preferences.
Access the settings for internal storage on my device.
I want to check my memory card configuration settings.
Bring up the input method settings on the device.
Let's adjust the language & input settings on my phone.
I need to view the security settings on my phone.
Could you please open my device's basic system configuration options?
Could you please switch on my airplane mode settings screen?

tools.description:
Opens a specific settings screen on the device.

This function allows you to open various system settings screens,
providing quick access to different device configuration options.

setting_type.description:
The type of settings screen to open.
Possible values are:
- "general": General settings (default)
- "wireless": Wireless & network settings
- "airplane_mode": Airplane mode settings
- "wifi": Wi-Fi settings
- "apn": APN settings
- "bluetooth": Bluetooth settings
- "date": Date & time settings
- "locale": Language & input settings
- "input_method": Input method settingFs
- "display": Display settings
- "security": Security settings
- "location": Location settings
- "internal_storage": Internal storage settings
- "memory_card": Memory card settings

returns.description: A confirmation message indicating the requested settings screen opened successfully.

examples:
# Open general settings
open_settings()

# Open Wi-Fi settings
open_settings("wifi")

# Open Bluetooth settings
open_settings("bluetooth")

Please look up the location of the Statue of Liberty.
Where exactly is Central Park located?
Locate 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA for me.
Find the address for Buckingham Palace.
Can you search the area around Times Square in NYC?
I need directions to the Sydney Opera House, please search its location.
Could you retrieve the address for 350 5th Ave, New York, NY?
Search for the Golden Gate Bridge.
I want to find out where the Pyramids of Giza are located. Please look it up.
Could you search for the location of the Louvre Museum?
What is the address of the Colosseum? Please find it.
Lookup 10 Downing Street for me.
Identify the location of the CN Tower in Toronto.
Can you help me find the Golden Gate Bridge?

tools.description:
Perform a location search (for a place or physical address) using the given query.

This function might open a map application or a location picker to find the specified place or address.

query.description: The location or address to search for.

returns.description: A string representing the result of the search (e.g., an address or coordinates)
example: Statue of Liberty, New York, NY 10004, USA

examples:
# Search for an address
address = search_location("1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA")

query: Hey, can you send an email to alice@example.com regarding the quarterly meeting updates?
Compose a quick email to bob@company.com and mention that I'll call him later.

arguments.body: I'll call him later.

query: Draft an email to carol123@mail.com with the subject 'Report Submission' and attach the file report.pdf.
Send an email to dave@workplace.org saying that the document is attached.

arguments.body: the document is attached

arguments.subject: Party Invitation
arguments.body: Join my birthday bash at 7 PM

arguments.body: we received his proposal

arguments.subject: Urgent: Server downtime
arguments.body: Server will be down for maintenance tonight

arguments.body: our meeting has been rescheduled to tomorrow afternoon

arguments.subject: New Partnership
arguments.body: Let's discuss our new partnership soon.

query: Please send an email to kate@domain.com informing her about the policy updates.

arguments.body: informing her about the policy updates

arguments.subject: Budget Review
arguments.body: 10% decrease in expenses since last quarter

arguments.body: I'm interested in the job opening

query: Send an email to nancy@service.net that simply says 'Thank you for your support'.

arguments.body: Thank you for your support

query: Kindly prepare an email for oliver@company.com with the subject 'Follow-up' and no additional content.
Send an email to jessica@works.com to thank her for her assistance.

arguments.body: Thank you for your assistance

tools.description:
Compose an email with the given details and send it using an email app.

This function can populate fields like recipient, subject, and body, then launch an email client to send the message.

to.description: Email address of the recipient.

attachments.description: List of file URIs to attach to the email.

returns.description: A confirmation message indicating the email was sent, including the recipient's email address.

examples:
# Send an email to john@samsung.com with reminding today's meeting
send_email({"to": "john@samsung.com", "body": "reminding today's meeting"})

tools.description:
Send an SMS or messaging app text with the given content.

This function sends a text message to a specified phone number (or contact) with an optional content body. Attachments (like images) may be provided as URIs.

to.description: Phone number or contact to send the message to.

message.description: The text content of the message.

attachments.description: List of content URIs (e.g., images or files) to attach to the message.

returns.description: A confirmation message indicating the text was sent, including the recipient's contact information.

examples:
# Send a text message
send_message({"to":  "+1234567890", "message":  "Hello there!"})

tools.description:
Initiates a web search using the specified query.

This function starts a web search using the default search engine.
It opens the search results in the default web browser or appropriate search application.

query.description: The search string or query to look up.

returns.description: A summary message indicating the web search was successfully initiated along with a brief preview of search content.
example: Search results for 'Python programming tutorials': Tutorials, courses, and guides on Python programming available.

examples:
# Simple web search
web_search("Python programming tutorials")

# Search for a phrase
web_search('"to be or not to be"')

# Search using a specific search engine
web_search("Python programming tutorials", "google")

query: Could you play the song 'Bohemian Rhapsody' on Spotify?
Play some music.
I would like to listen to 'Stairway to Heaven', please.
Can you start music playback on Apple Music?
Please play 'Shape of You' by Ed Sheeran via Deezer.
Could you launch the default music player?
I want to hear 'Hotel California'.
Start playing music on SoundCloud, I want to check out some tracks.
Play the track with URI 'spotify:track:6rqhFgbbKwnb9MLmUQDhG6'.
Fire up my tunes and play 'Imagine - John Lennon'.
I feel like enjoying a meditative tune on Pandora; get it started.
Could you initiate playback of the remix version of 'Bad Guy' on Tidal?
Start some tunes!
Launch my music app and play 'Rolling in the Deep'.
Hey, play 'Uptown Funk' on the Jango app.
Can you please play some tunes via the default music app?

tools.description:
Plays music using a specified Music application or the default player.

This function will send an intent to play music. If a specific app or track is provided, it will attempt to play that; otherwise, it may open a music app.

track.description: The name or URI of the track to play (optional).

app.description: The specific music app to use (optional). If not provided, uses the default music player.

returns.description: A confirmation message indicating music playback has started successfully.

examples:
# Play a song by name
play_music({"track": "Imagine - John Lennon"})

This function will send an intent to play the given video. If a specific app or video URI is provided, it will attempt to play that; otherwise, it opens the default video player.

video_uri.description: The URI of the video to play (optional). If not provided, this will open the default video player.

app.description: The specific video player app to use (optional). If not provided, uses the default video player.

returns.description: A confirmation message indicating video playback has started successfully.

examples:
# Play a specific video
play_video({"video_uri": video_file_uri})

query: Launch my preferred video app: MX Player with this file: http://server.com/media.mp4.

query: Could you please launch the YouTube app on my device?
I want to listen to some music, can you open Spotify for me?
Open WhatsApp so that I can chat with my friends.
Please launch Google Maps; I need directions to a new restaurant.
I need to check my emails, could you please open Gmail?
Start the Instagram application on my phone.
Can you kick off the Chrome browser for me?
Launch the Weather app immediately, I'm curious about today's forecast.
Switch on the Calculator so I can do some quick math.
Trigger the Calendar application; I need to schedule an important meeting.
Please start the Facebook app right away.
I would appreciate it if you could open the Twitter app for me.
Can you begin the Notes application for some quick jotting?
Make sure to run the Alarm app so I wake up on time.
Could you launch my file manager? I need to organize some documents.
Launch the Calculator app so I can crunch some numbers quickly.

tools.description:
Launches another application on the device by package name or intent.

This function allows the assistant to open another app. If a package name or intent is provided, it attempts to launch that application.

application_name.description: The name of the application to launch.

returns.description: A confirmation message indicating the specified application launched successfully.

examples:
# Launch the YouTube app
launch_application({"application_name": "YouTube"})

This function allows the assistant to open another app. If a package name or intent is provided, it attempts to launch that application.

application_name.description: The name of the application to launch.

returns.description: A confirmation message indicating the specified application launched successfully.

examples:
# Launch the YouTube app
launch_application({"application_name": "YouTube"})

query: Please open the document at content://documents/doc/123 for editing.
Edit my document located at content://files/doc/456 and pre-populate it with 'Important updates required'.
I want to revise the document from content://docs/doc/789. Could you add 'Draft version approved' as the starting content?
Open up document content://documents/doc/321 for me to modify.
Can you edit the content at content://docs/notes/654? Please pre-fill it with 'Meeting notes: discuss quarterly targets'.
Take a look at the file at content://data/doc/111 and insert the text 'Revised draft version'.
I need to update the document content at content://files/reports/789. Please add 'Final adjustments' to the document.
Open content://workspace/doc/202 for editing. I don't need any prepended text.
Modify document content://archive/doc/333 by pre-inserting 'Archival update pending'.
Could you launch editing mode for the document at content://documents/updates/555 with the pre-filled content: 'Update timeline soon'?
Need to work on my note at content://mynotes/doc/777, no additional text required.
Please amend the document at content://docs/reports/888 and set 'Revised by manager' as starting text.
I'm aiming to revise the content stored at content://workspace/letters/999. Insert the edit note 'Please review changes'.
Could you access the document at content://docs/drafts/101 and make it editable?
Kindly re-open the file at content://files/notes/2020. Begin with the phrase 'Updated version'.
Please edit the document at content://files/report/100 and pre-fill it with 'Initial draft'.

tools.description:
Edit an existing document.

This function opens the document specified by the given content URI for editing. It allows the user to modify the document's content. Additional content can be provided to pre-fill or insert into the document if supported.

document_uri.description: The content URI of the document to edit.

content.description: The content to insert or update in the document before editing. Default is None.

returns.description: A URI as a string pointing to the edited document (usually the same as the input URI if saved), or None if the edit was canceled.

examples:
# Edit a document by URI
edited_doc_uri = ACTION_EDIT_DOCUMENT(document_uri)

# Edit a document and pre-fill text
edited_doc_uri = ACTION_EDIT_DOCUMENT(document_uri, "Initial content...")

Set the device's ringtone.

This function changes the default incoming call ringtone to the specified audio file.

ringtone_uri.description: The content URI of the new ringtone audio to set.

returns.description: A confirmation message indicating the ringtone was changed successfully (including the ringtone name if available).

examples:
# Set the ringtone to a selected sound 'content://media/ringtone01'
ACTION_SET_RINGTONE('content://media/ringtone01')

query: Could you modify my alarm with id 1 so that it rings at 7:30 AM and displays the label 'Wake up'?
Please update alarm with id 3 to ring at 22:15 and disable vibration.
I want to change alarm 5 to go off at 5:00 AM and add the note 'Gym time'.
Edit my alarm with id 7 so that it rings at 9:20 PM with the message 'Dinner Time', and set it to repeat every day.
Can you change my alarm with id 10 to ring at 12:05 PM?
I need to modify alarm 4 so that it rings at 18:50, uses the ringtone at 'ringtone://unique', and doesn't show the confirmation UI.
Update my alarm with id 8 to 3:30 in the afternoon, set it to repeat on weekends (Saturday and Sunday), and ensure vibration is enabled.
Please set alarm 12 to ring at 06:00 with the label 'Meeting' and turn off vibration.
Adjust alarm id 9 to go off at 11:45 PM and remove any repeat days settings.
Change alarm number 6 to 7:10 AM, set its label to 'Workout', and configure it to repeat on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday.
Modify alarm 15 so that it rings at 00:30 and bypass the clock app UI by setting automatic confirmation.
Revise the alarm with id 11 to sound at 14:25 and include a note saying 'Lunch reminder'.
Switch my alarm with id 13 to 7:00 PM and set it to use the ringtone from 'sound://alert'.
Could you please update alarm 14 so that it rings at 8:35 AM with the message 'School', and make it repeat on weekdays?
Would you modify alarm id 20 to go off at 16:40 and prevent the clock UI from showing, while keeping the default message?
Please adjust alarm 1 to ring at 07:00 and set the label to 'Wake Up'.

tools.description:
Edit an existing alarm.

This function allows the user to modify an alarm that is already set. The alarm is identified by an ID or index, and the user can change its time, label, repeat days, vibration, or ringtone.

alarm_id.description: The identifier of the alarm to edit (e.g., an ID or index from the alarm list).

EXTRA_DAYS.description: List of days when the alarm should repeat (e.g., ["Monday", "Wednesday"]). Empty list or missing means no repeat.

EXTRA_VIBRATE.description: Whether the alarm should vibrate. Default is True.

EXTRA_RINGTONE.description: The URI of the ringtone to use for this alarm. Default ringtone if None.

EXTRA_SKIP_UI.description: If true, sets the alarm without showing the clock app UI for confirmation.

returns.description: A confirmation message describing the updated alarm (new time, label, etc.), or None if the edit was canceled.
example: alarm_id: alarm_no1 has updated to 8:30 AM: Morning alarm

examples:
# Edit Alarm 'alarm_no1' to 8:30 AM
ACTION_EDIT_ALARM(alarm_id='alarm_no1',"EXTRA_HOUR": 7, "EXTRA_MINUTES": 30)

This function allows the user to modify an alarm that is already set. The alarm is identified by an ID or index, and the user can change its time, label, repeat days, vibration, or ringtone.

alarm_id.description: The identifier of the alarm to edit (e.g., an ID or index from the alarm list).

EXTRA_DAYS.description: List of days when the alarm should repeat (e.g., ["Monday", "Wednesday"]). Empty list or missing means no repeat.

EXTRA_VIBRATE.description: Whether the alarm should vibrate. Default is True.

EXTRA_RINGTONE.description: The URI of the ringtone to use for this alarm. Default ringtone if None.

EXTRA_SKIP_UI.description: If true, sets the alarm without showing the clock app UI for confirmation.

returns.description: A confirmation message describing the updated alarm (new time, label, etc.), or None if the edit was canceled.
example: alarm_id: alarm_no1 has updated to 8:30 AM: Morning alarm

examples:
# Edit Alarm 'alarm_no1' to 8:30 AM
ACTION_EDIT_ALARM(alarm_id='alarm_no1',"EXTRA_HOUR": 7, "EXTRA_MINUTES": 30)

ACTION_EDIT_ALARM(alarm_id='alarm_no1',"EXTRA_HOUR": 7, "EXTRA_MINUTES": 30)

query: Switch alarm 40 to a new time of 16:00, leaving all other settings unchanged.

tools.description:
Edit an existing alarm.

This function allows the user to modify an alarm that is already set. The alarm is identified by an ID or index, and the user can change its time, label, repeat days, vibration, or ringtone.

alarm_id.description: The identifier of the alarm to edit (e.g., an ID or index from the alarm list).

EXTRA_DAYS.description: List of days when the alarm should repeat (e.g., ["Monday", "Wednesday"]). Empty list or missing means no repeat.

EXTRA_VIBRATE.description: Whether the alarm should vibrate. Default is True.

EXTRA_RINGTONE.description: The URI of the ringtone to use for this alarm. Default ringtone if None.

EXTRA_SKIP_UI.description: If true, sets the alarm without showing the clock app UI for confirmation.

returns.description: A confirmation message describing the updated alarm (new time, label, etc.), or None if the edit was canceled.
example: alarm_id: alarm_no1 has updated to 8:30 AM: Morning alarm

examples:
# Edit Alarm 'alarm_no1' to 8:30 AM
ACTION_EDIT_ALARM(alarm_id='alarm_no1',"EXTRA_HOUR": 7, "EXTRA_MINUTES": 30)

tools.description:
Edit a video file.

This function opens a video specified by its URI in an editing mode, allowing the user to trim or modify the video. Optional parameters can be provided to automatically apply edits such as trimming or muting the video.

video_uri.description: The content URI of the video to edit.

edit_options.description: A dictionary of editing options. Keys can include 'start_time' (ms), 'end_time' (ms) for trimming, and 'mute' (bool) to remove audio. Default is None.

returns.description: A content URI as a string pointing to the edited video (a new video file if changes are saved), or None if editing was canceled.

examples:
# Open a video content://videos/presentation.mp4 for manual editing
edited_video_uri = ACTION_EDIT_VIDEO(video_uri='content://videos/presentation.mp4)

# Trim a video 'content://videos/clip001.mp4' to first 30 seconds
edited_video_uri = ACTION_EDIT_VIDEO(video_uri='content://videos/clip001.mp4', {"start_time": 0, "end_time": 30000})

returns.description: A content URI as a string pointing to the edited video (a new video file if changes are saved), or None if editing was canceled.

examples:
# Open a video content://videos/presentation.mp4 for manual editing
edited_video_uri = ACTION_EDIT_VIDEO(video_uri='content://videos/presentation.mp4)

# Trim a video 'content://videos/clip001.mp4' to first 30 seconds
edited_video_uri = ACTION_EDIT_VIDEO(video_uri='content://videos/clip001.mp4', {"start_time": 0, "end_time": 30000})

tools.description:
Start navigation to a specified location.

This function launches a maps/navigation app to guide the user to the given destination, which can be provided as an address or coordinates.

location.description: The destination to navigate to (address string or latitude,longitude coordinates).

returns.description: navigation is started in a maps application
example: navigation is started in a maps application: Statue of Liberty, New York, NY 10004, USA

examples:
# Start navigation to an '1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA'
ACTION_NAVIGATE_TO_LOCATION("1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA")

tools.description:
View a calendar event's details.

This function opens the calendar event specified by the given content URI and displays its details (title, time, location, etc.).

event_uri.description: The content URI of the calendar event to view.

returns.description: A Event detail as a string or a summary of Event details, or None if the event could not be displayed.
example: Meeting with Bob at 3:00 PM on Sep 15

examples:
# View a calendar event 'content://calender/event/1'
ACTION_VIEW_EVENT(event_uri='content://calender/event/1')

This function opens the calendar event specified by the given content URI and displays its details (title, time, location, etc.).

event_uri.description: The content URI of the calendar event to view.

returns.description: A Event detail as a string or a summary of Event details, or None if the event could not be displayed.
example: Meeting with Bob at 3:00 PM on Sep 15

examples:
# View a calendar event 'content://calender/event/1'
ACTION_VIEW_EVENT(event_uri='content://calender/event/1')

query: Can you show me all the timers that are currently running?
I would like to see the list of active timers. Please display them.
What timers are operating right now? Show them for me.
Display my active timers.
I'm curious to know which timers are still going. Could you list them?
Please retrieve and show all timers that are currently active.
List any timers that are still in progress, thanks.
I need to check the status of my timers. Can you display all active ones?
Could you provide the current list of running timers on my device?
Show me all the timers that haven't expired yet.
I want to review my ongoing timers. Display them please.
Kindly show the active timers currently set in the system.
What are my active timers? I need to see a list of them now.
Retrieve and display all currently active timers.
Please show any timers that are active at the moment.
Please display the list of active timers.

tools.description: Display the list of active timers.

returns.description: A string listing all currently active timers. number of timers could be 1 ~ 5. generate creatively and diversely
example: Active timers: [5 minutes - Pasta, 10 minutes - Workout]

examples:
# Show all timers
ACTION_SHOW_TIMERS()

query: Could you please show me the recent call log from my device?
I need to access my latest call history. Can you pull it up?
Display the recent calls on my phone, including missed, answered, and outgoing calls.
Show my phone's call log from today and yesterday.
Retrieve the list of all calls made, received, or missed on my device recently.
I want to see my call history. Could you fetch the recent call log?
Open the recent call records saved on my mobile device.
List the phone calls recorded on my device most recently.
Access and display my recent call log details from the phone.
Can you open my recent call history so that I can check who I talked to?
I need a rundown of my latest phone calls, including types and times.
Please retrieve my phone's recent call log to show the calls made and received.
Fetch the recent call data from my device's log.
I want to review my call history. Could you display the recent calls on my phone?
Get the details of the most recent calls logged on my device.
Show me my call history from today's phone calls.

tools.description:
View the device's call log (recent calls).

This function retrieves and displays the recent call history, including incoming, outgoing, and missed calls.

returns.description: A string listing recent call log entries (caller names/numbers and call times/types), or None if the call log is empty or inaccessible.
example: Call log: Alice +1-302-3782 (Missed) - Today 2:45 PM; Bob (Outgoing) +1-872-1285 - Yesterday 1:15 PM

examples:
# View recent calls
ACTION_VIEW_CALL_LOG()

query: Can you show me a list of emails I've sent recently?
I need to view my sent mails folder; please display the emails along with their recipients.
Please pull up the sent emails from my account so I can check the recipients and subjects.
Show me my recently dispatched emails.
I want to see all the emails I've sent out lately. Can you display them?
Fetch my sent email list, please. I'm interested in checking the messages I've already sent.
Could you list out the emails I sent recently including the recipients' addresses?
Display my outgoing messages folder so I can review what emails have been sent.
I need an overview of my sent emails. Show the list with subject lines and receiver details.
List the contents of my sent mailbox to check which emails have been sent out recently.
Kindly display the emails I have sent, so I can review the recent communications.
I would like to examine my sent emails folder. Please show all sent emails along with their details.
Pull up the list of emails I have dispatched, including recipient info and email subjects.
Show my outgoing emails so I can check the messages I recently sent.
Could you retrieve my sent email logs? I want to see who I emailed and the related subjects.
Can you show me the emails I've sent recently along with their recipients?

tools.description:
View the list of sent emails.

This function displays emails from the user's sent mail folder, showing recently sent emails and their recipients.

returns.description: A string listing recently sent emails (recipients and subjects), or None if no sent emails are found.
example: Sent emails: to alice@example.com - 'Project Update'; to bob@example.com - 'Meeting Agenda'

examples:

query: Show my Road Trip playlist.
I need to hear some tunes from my workout mix. Can you open the playlist named 'Workout Mix'?
Can you display the songs from my Chill Vibes playlist?
Please bring up my 'Summer Hits' playlist, I want to review the track list.
Access the Rock Classics playlist, please.
View my Jazz Essentials playlist for tonights listening session.
Open the playlist called 'Acoustic Mornings'.
I want to check the details of my 'Party Anthems' playlist. Could you show it?
Could you show the songs in the 'Sleep Sounds' playlist?
I would like to see my 'Indie Mix' playlist on the app.
Let me review my 'Classical Favorites' playlist.
Display the playlist 'Hip Hop Beats' for me.
Take a look at the 'Mellow Indie' playlist I created.
Retrieve the 'Electronic Vibes' playlist song list, please.
Show me the 'Retro Hits' playlist.
Could you pull up the 'Jazz Classics' playlist for me?

tools.description:
View a music playlist.

This function opens the specified playlist in the music app and displays its songs.

playlist_name.description: The name of the playlist to view.

returns.description: A string summarizing the playlist (e.g., a list of some song titles), or None if the playlist is not found.
example: Playlist 'Road Trip': Highway to Hell; Sweet Child O' Mine; Back in Black

examples:
# View a playlist by name
ACTION_VIEW_PLAYLIST("Road Trip")

tools.description:
View the list of recently used apps.
